summary: This mod aims to create the most amount of crafting options possible using vanilla assets - the way it should have been from the start. This mod adds the ability to tailor your own clothing and smith/improve armors/weapons that were previously disabled from the crafting system.
descriptionHtml:
THE IDEA:
=========
Ever feel the need to craft clothing? Ever want to craft a piece of armor found normally in the game, but you could not find in the smithing menu? Shouldn't being a master smith mean you can craft ANYTHING? Well of course it should. Bethesda left out some key pieces that just do not make sense. I aim to change that entirely in as few files as possible, by introducing Korodic's Crafting Overhaul. :)


...Before we get started:
*This mod is script-free! By using this mod you don't have to worry about performance related issues other mods may bring to the table. :D
*All created items are un-enchanted and enchantable.
*All created clothing items are considered "clothing" and will work with the Mage Armor perk.
*Any mod that changes or uses the 'Wood' or 'Studded' crafting categories may conflict with this.
*Tanning racks and smelters now give experience, because taking apart/manipulating things is a good way to learn something too.
*Guard armor is classified as Iron Armor.
*Thieves Guild is now classified as Leather.
*Dark Brotherhood is now classified as Leather.
*Forsworn is now considered Hide.
*Clothing can only be created at the clothing crafting locations using the tailoring loom+dye lab.
*Misc metallic objects can now be melted down into ingots.
*Objects that consist of wood can now be transformed into Firewood. Why? Because if you collect enough scrap wood you should be able to burn it or use it to help make arrows and rather than making a ton of absurd recipes we will just throw them into Firewood :)

====================

CLOTHING CRAFTING LOCATIONS:
==============================
*Whiterun - Arcadia's Cauldron
*Solitude - Radiant Raiment
*Markarth - Arnleif & Sons Trading Company

WEAPONS AVAILABLE FOR CRAFTING:
=================================
* Blades
* Daedric Artifacts (Replica versions only...)
* Falmer
* Pickaxe
* Shiv (YAYYY!)
* Skyforge Weapons
* ...AND MORE!

ARMOR AVAILABLE FOR CRAFTING:
===============================
* Blades
* Daedric Artifact (replica versions only...)
* Dark Brotherhood & Variants
* Falmer
* Forsworn
* Fur
* Imperial & Variants
* Stormcloak
* Thieves Guild & Variants
* ...AND MORE!


CREDITS & FILE PERMISSIONS
==========================
I spent a long time creating this crafting system trying to get it to be perfect while editing as few base objects/locations as possible (this creates better stability in terms of compatibility). Should you wish to use assets such as the crafting stations (loom or dye lab) simply check off my mod in the creation kit and set yours as the active file. You can copy/paste them from the KCOTEST cell, no need to try to grab them inside any edited vanilla cells. c:

I only ask that you credit me. <3

Fixes & value changes were integrated from the following mods:

[URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34093/?]Weapon & Armor Fixes[/URL] & [URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43053/?]Clothing and Clutter Fixes[/URL] by [URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4291352/?]kryptopyr[/URL]

Although I created my mod from scratch, I was inspired from the following mods:

[URL=http://steamcommunity.com/id/LordBuckles/myworkshopfiles/?appid=72850]Buckles[/URL], author of [URL=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=108569807]"Tailoring"[/URL]

[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/1580769/?]Valdosa[/URL], author of [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/874]"Vals Crafting Meltdown"[/URL]

[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3193983/?]AeonVita[/URL], author of [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/799]"More Craftables"[/URL]

My intention is to combine all the concepts into one file - created in the CK (official skyrim mod tool), to cut down on conflicts, load order, and give pure convenience. ;)

Combined versions inbound, BUT! I *need* your help in wading through any possible issues/complaints. Please give any suggestions/feedback to me in the comment section !!!!
